data.title: Event: Rethinking Capitalism
data.subtitle: Economics where People and the Environment matter
data.text:
This two-day seminar includes discussion on some of the most pressing economic issues facing the world today.

Topics include inequality, insecurity, climate change, the national budget and a campaign for a fairer and more sustainable economy, drawn from modern monetary theory and ecological economics.

**Course outline:** Adapted from a university economics subject, the course is divided into ten units, most of which feature a 20-30 minute introduction, a 10-15 minute video and at least 20 minutes of small-group discussion. The timetable is subject to minor changes, but this will give some idea of the scope of the course.

**Facilitator:** Associate Professor [Steven Hail](https://www.linkedin.com/in/steven-hail-27b7b910), Lecturer at Torrens University Australia and Economist at Modern Money Lab.

###### *DAY ONE*

10:00-10:10 Welcome, housekeeping

10:10-11:30 Part One: Rethinking Value

11.30-12:00 Morning Tea

12:00-1:00 Part Two: Ecological Economics and the Doughnut

1:00-2:00 Lunch

2:00-3:00 Part Three: The Deficit Myth

3:00-3.30 Afternoon Tea

3:30-4.30 Part Four: Income Inequality and Well-Being

Evening Social

###### *DAY TWO*

10:00-11.00 Part Five: An Economics Fit for Humans

11:00-11:30 Morning Tea

11.30-12:30 Part Six: Rethinking Trade and Development

12:30-1:30 Lunch

1:30-2:30 Part Seven: A National Job Guarantee

2:30-3:00 Afternoon Tea

3:00-4:00 Part Eight: Freeing the State from Capture

4.00-4:30 Part Nine: Conclusion - Planting a Tree
